title: Global Seminar—Early History of Psychiatry: Psychiatry, Neuroscience, and Pharmacology of the Renaissance through the Enlightenment
description: This course provides a survey of the rebirth of life sciences during the Renaissance, the emergence of psychiatry as a distinct science, and the emergence of modern pharmacology from the Reformation to the early modern period. Prerequisites: Students must submit applications to the International Center Programs Abroad Office and be accepted into the Global Seminar Program.
